comment: Smart Data Models - Equipment adapted to DTDL from smartdatamodels.org. Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.EnergyCIM/master/Equipment/schema.json
description: Adapted from CIM data models. The parts of a power system that are physical devices, electronic or mechanical.

contents.name: EquipmentContainer
contents.comment: Container of this equipment. Default: None

contents.name: OperationalLimitSet
contents.comment: The operational limit sets associated with this equipment. Default: 'list'

contents.name: aggregate
contents.comment: The single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modeled together as an aggregate.  Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modeled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  This is not to be used to indicate equipment that is part of a group of interdependent equipment produced by a network production program. Default: False

contents.name: alternateName
contents.comment: An alternative name for this item

contents.name: areaServed
contents.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided

contents.name: dataProvider
contents.comment: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity.

contents.name: dateCreated
contents.comment: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: dateModified
contents.comment: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: source
contents.comment: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object.

contents.name: owner
contents.comment: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)
